I am applying, because I am heavily involved with preparing new upstream kernels for Ubuntu. This work includes compatibility updates for the various DKMS modules in Ubuntu. I would like to be able to sponsor these uploads in order to reduce delays in getting DKMS fixes / updates and to reduce the burden on other sponsors.

== Who I am ==
I am working as a software engineer in the <nowiki>[[KernelTeam|{{https:--launchpadlibrarian.net-7080714-ubuntu-kernel-team-small.png}}]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[KernelTeam|Ubuntu Kernel Team]]</nowiki> at Canonical since 2019. I am specialized in operating systems, embedded systems, virtualization solutions and system architectures.

I received the Laurea degree in Computer Engineering at the University of Siena on 2004. I have contributed to many open-source projects, with a particular interest with the Linux kernel. As an outcome of my development efforts I have implemented the <nowiki>[[https://lwn.net/Articles/332839/|cgroup-io-throttle]]</nowiki> patch set, that ultimately evolved into the blkio cgroup controller (merged into the mainline kernel).

== My Ubuntu story ==
I started using Ubuntu with the 7.04 release after trying a number of other distros over the years, and since that time Ubuntu has been my distro of choice.

=== Areas of work ===
My primary focus has been getting new upstream kernel versions into Ubuntu, fixing up packages impacted by these kernel updates. I am also involved in bug fixes for stable series kernels and uploading kernel SRUs.

=== Things I could do better ===
My overall packaging experience is almost entirely with kernel or kernel-adjacent packages. I would like to extend my knowledge to a more diverse types of package.
